messages: c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:23): impressed by 4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 joining the channel at 6am!
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:25): heycam: yo
4dd217ba7542bb00a127f682e2c3ad27 (13:26): needs massive amounts of coffee :-)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:27): is lucky never to have gotten on the coffee monkey
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:28): is driven by sheer paranoia :)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:28): only got that monkey off his back about 4 months ago. I found it makes no difference (except I no longer get headaches when I don't have it!)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:29): life editin specs' is a rush, man! :P
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:29): oh, you sad little man
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:30): Shapazu, did you see the interview I did with Harry Halpin?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:30): I saw the first part... I intend to watch the rest tomorrow
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:31): oh ok. He's a crazy fun dude :) I really liked hanging out with him while I was in the UK.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:32): I'm hoping he will come to TPAC.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:33): yeah, Harry's awesome
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (13:33): he's like a standards rockstar
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:34): hehe; I don't doubt it.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:38): Arve (or anyone or twitterverse :P ), why is multi-part MIME  unsuitable for widget packaging?
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (13:51): argh... I hate it when I need to learn new stuff and do my own thinking...
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:11): Ok, keeping in mind I don't really know MIME, here are some thoughts as to why MIME is unsuitable:
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:11): 1. lack of packaging tools for MIME (zip is more prevalent and ships with almost every OS)

c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:11): 2. difficult for authors to work with compared to zip: zip is built into many operating systems (such as WindowsXP/Vista) and allows authors to easily modify the content of packages.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:11): 3. lack of compression

c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:11): 4. all widget engines already support Zip, so using MIME would be "going against the grain" with regards to standardization and would delay implementation as widget engines may need to be significantly changed to support MIME.
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:14): 2) Compression inefficiency
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:14): you are just using fancy words for what i said :)
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:15): there is basically a 8/6 inefficiency you suffer for Base-64
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:15): I need to convince the TAG to stop pushing MIME on us
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:16): That zip is ubiquotus should alone be enough
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:16): yeah, that's what I think too
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:17): browsers/UAs already support zip
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:17): supporting multipart is, at best, a bolt-on in FF
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:17): and I know of exactly zero tools that will allow me to to take a lump of files from a disk and create a sensible multipart
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:19): and I do not believe that parties who've invested in the widget economy/landscape are willing to wait until 2012 for the same tool support
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:20): if anything, I think we should specify the relevant subset of zip in an open industry group
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:21): I guess that's what we will have in the packaging spec.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:21): (the relevant subset)
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:22): c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774: well, we do so by reference
85793dd1775fbc0c0562493f069bcaa2 (14:22): I'd ideally like to see the compression algorithms in such a separate spec
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:23): Well, we only support one at the moment. And it is in a separate spec.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:23): so your wish may already have come true
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:26): Deflate: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1951
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (14:26): if that is what you mean
